review: I have had this adapter for under 24 hours and I am in love! I bought 3 more this morning for every TV in my house including a 8 inch android tablet for a universal remote. Right now I have my phone and computer to play with and it's amazing. Streaming quality is fantastic and very easy to setup. Although it is currently limited with the few apps that support it, I suspect they have only touched the surface. The ability to stream from my phone or tablet via Netflix, Hulu and Youtube to any TV is amazing and media servers simply can't compete.

author: MadBrit

review: Got this to try. I have a TV in the bedroom with a spare HDMI input and figured for $35 bucks what do I have to loose. I bought it on impulse and didn't do a lot of research. I figured it would work mostly like the roku with fewer available apps and controlled via smartphone/tablet. One of the things that looked really cool in the ad was the guy browsing the internet, and then "flicking" the browser page from a table onto the TV. That looked cool, and would allow me to surf in bed without reading glasses for my tablet!It does not do that...on an android tablet. You can do it from a laptop, or a WIN 8 tablet, maybe even from an iPad, but the android chrome browser does not have chromecast support. So all you can really do is Netflix, Hulu plus, and Youtube, HBOgo and Pandora and of course buy stuff from the Google Play Store. It is almost unbelievable that the android support is so poor. There are a few other beta apps, but not a lot. No easy way to stream other content directly off your device or computer (yea there are some workarounds). Android browser support is coming...someday.I'll keep playing with it. Maybe Google will update it some day to be more useful.Pro: Youtube (still not available on Roku)Cons: Does not do what it says. No real advantage over Roku (other than Youtube). No remote, Not very many apps/channels.Edit: I carefully re-watched the video's and they technically never say or show web browsing from an android device, but I still feel like it is almost inconceivable that they do not have this working. Chromecast didn't come out yesterday. There are some third party solutions, so it's technically possible.
author: Joe
